Detailed Description

Class for the output parameters of the position-based Online Trajectory Generation algorithm.

The class RMLPositionOutputParameters is derived from the class RMLOutputParameters and constitutes a part of the interface for the position-based Online Trajectory Generation algorithm.

See also:

bool RMLPositionOutputParameters::WillTheTargetPositionBeExceeded ( void  ) const [inline]

Indicates, whether the currently computed trajectory will exceed the desired target position in order to reach the desired target state.

If the currently computed trajectory exceeds the desired target position , this flag will be set to true.

Returns:
The method returns true if the trajectory will exceed its target position before reaching its target state and false if not.
See also:
RMLPositionOutputParameters::TrajectoryExceedsTargetPosition

Member Data Documentation

bool RMLPositionOutputParameters::TrajectoryExceedsTargetPosition

Indicates, whether the currently computed trajectory will exceed the desired target position in order to reach the desired target state.

If the currently computed trajectory exceeds the desired target position before reaching the desired target state of motion , this flag will be set to true.

This attribute can be accessed directly or by using the method WillTheTargetPositionBeExceeded().

Note:
If the input flag RMLFlags::EnableTheCalculationOfTheExtremumMotionStates is not set, this output flag will also not be computed (by default the this input flag is set).
See also:
Example 2 — Making Use of Output Parameters of the Position-based algorithm
